metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9351 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
engine/server/server.cpp in Teeworlds 0.6.x before 0.6.3 allows remoteattackers to read memory and cause a denial of service (crash) viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

teeworlds - 0.6.2+dfsg-2
teeworlds-data - 0.6.2+dfsg-2
teeworlds-server - 0.6.2+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: teeworlds package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.2+dfsg-2').
